statements.name: PROC HPFARIMASPEC
statements.description: The HPFARIMASPEC procedure is used to create an ARIMA (autoregressive integrated moving average) model specification file. The output of this procedure is an XML file that stores the intended ARIMA model specification.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a descriptive label for the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file reference.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Names the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file reference.

arguments.name: REPOSITORY=
arguments.description: Names the SAS catalog or external file reference to contain the model specification.

statements.name: ESTIMATE
statements.description: This is an optional statement in the procedure. Here you can specify the estimation method or whether to hold the model parameters fixed to their starting values. You can also specify some parameters that control the nonlinear optimization process.

arguments.name: CONVERGE=
arguments.description: Specifies the convergence criterion.

arguments.name: DELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the perturbation value for computing numerical derivatives.

arguments.name: GRIDVAL=
arguments.description: [Help info is not currently available.]

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations allowed.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the estimation method to use.

arguments.name: ML
arguments.description: Maximum likelihood

arguments.name: ULS
arguments.description: Unconditional least squares

arguments.name: CLS
arguments.description: Conditional least squares

arguments.name: NOEST
arguments.description: Uses the values specified with the AR=, MA=, and so on, as final parameter values. The estimation process is suppressed except for the estimation of the residual variance.

arguments.name: NOLS
arguments.description: Begins the maximum likelihood or unconditional least squares iterations from the preliminary estimates rather than from the conditional least squares estimates that are produced after four iterations.

arguments.name: NOSTABLE
arguments.description: Specifies that the autoregressive and moving average parameter estimates for the noise part of the model not be restricted to the stationary and invertible regions, respectively.

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the criterion for checking singularity.

statements.name: FORECAST
statements.description: The FORECAST statement specifies the operations to be performed on the response series as well as the autoregressive and moving average polynomials in the model.

arguments.name: AR=
arguments.description: Lists starting values for the autoregressive parameters.

arguments.name: DIF=
arguments.description: Specifies the differencing orders for the dependent series.

arguments.name: MA=
arguments.description: Lists starting values for the moving average parameters.

arguments.name: MU=
arguments.description: Specifies the MU parameter.

arguments.name: NOCONSTANT
arguments.description: Suppresses the fitting of a constant (or intercept) parameter in the model.

arguments.name: NOISEVAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the noise variance. This is useful only if you want to specify an externally published model that is fully specified.

arguments.name: P=
arguments.description: Syntax: P=order P=(lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) P=(lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk> Specifies the autoregressive part of the model.

arguments.name: Q=
arguments.description: Syntax: Q=order Q=(lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) Q=(lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk> Specifies the moving average part of the model.

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a symbolic name for the dependent series.

arguments.name: TRANSFORM=
arguments.description: Specifies the transformation to be applied to the time series.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No transformation applied

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: Logarithmic transformation

arguments.name: SQRT
arguments.description: Square-root transformation

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: Logistic transformation

arguments.name: BOXCOX
arguments.description: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5

arguments.name: TRANSOPT=
arguments.description: Specifies that mean or median forecasts be estimated.

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: Mean forecasts are estimated. This is the default.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Median forecasts are estimated.

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: The INPUT statements specify the transfer function inputs in the model. A separate INPUT statement is needed for each of the transfer function inputs.
statements.help: INPUT <DIF=order | DIF=( order1, order2, ...)> <PREDEFINED=<LINEAR | QUADRATIC | CUBIC>... > <(SYMBOL|VAR)=variable> ...

arguments.name: DC=
arguments.description: Lists starting values for the denominator polynomial coefficients.

arguments.name: DELAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the delay (or lag) order for the input series.

arguments.name: DEN=
arguments.description: [Syntax: DEN=order DEN= (lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) DEN= (lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk>] Specifies the denominator polynomial of the transfer function.

arguments.name: DIF=
arguments.description: Specifies the differencing orders for the input series.

arguments.name: NC=
arguments.description: Lists starting values for the numerator polynomial coefficients.

arguments.name: NUM=
arguments.description: [Syntax: NUM=order NUM= (lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) NUM= (lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk> ] Specifies the numerator polynomial of the transfer function.

arguments.name: NZ=
arguments.description: Specifies the scale parameter—that is, the zero degree coefficient of the numerator.

arguments.name: PREDEFINED=
arguments.description: Associates a predefined trend or a set of seasonal dummy variables with this transfer function.

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: Linear trend

arguments.name: QUADRATIC
arguments.description: Quadratic trend

arguments.name: CUBIC
arguments.description: Cubic trend

arguments.name: INVERSE
arguments.description: Inverse trend

arguments.name: SEASONAL
arguments.description: Seasonal dummies

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a symbolic name for the dependent series.

arguments.name: TRANSFORM=
arguments.description: Specifies the transformation to be applied to the time series.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No transformation applied

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: Logarithmic transformation

arguments.name: SQRT
arguments.description: Square-root transformation

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: Logistic transformation

arguments.name: BOXCOX
arguments.description: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5
